strapiEdition.headline: Pack Your Bags NWA: XNA Announces Nonstop Flight to Austin

posts.title: XNA to Offer Direct Flights to Austin for the First Time Ever
posts.content:
Live music here we come! Allegiant Air announced Tuesday that it would begin providing nonstop flights from Northwest Arkansas National Airport to Austin, Texas, with service beginning in July.

  • The is the first time XNA has offered a direct flight to the capital city of Texas, and select flights were on sale recently for a mere $49.
  • In 2019, NWA residents made over 9,000 trips to Austin. In years past, travelers would have connecting flights in Dallas or Houston or drive to Tulsa for a direct flight.
  • Allegiant's nonstop flights will occur on Mondays and Fridays, but numbers are likely to increase given the trip's popularity. Recognizing the growth and the opportunities that growth creates, Allegiant continues to increase its presence in Austin and at XNA. -Fare Flight NWA

posts.title: Backstreet's Back in Town for 2021
posts.content:
Backstreet's Back - Alright! The Backstreet Boys have officially rescheduled their DNA World Tour and plan to make an appearance at the Walmart AMP in Rogers on June 17, 2021.

  • Tickets originally purchased for 2020 will be recognized by the AMP, and those not planning to attend can contact the Walmart AMP Box Office by June 26, 2020 to request a full refund.
  • For a full list of upcoming concerts, check out the AMP's website. No, we aren't confused - UPCOMING events. Go now!

posts.title: Rooting for the Home Team with B-Unlimited
posts.content:
The countdown is officially ON for the 2021 Arkansas Razorback Baseball season as the Hogs are set to square off against their first opponent next week (!) How long have we been in quarantine again?

  • The Arkansas Baseball team's first game is next Friday (Feb. 19) against Texas Tech in Arlington, TX. With a highly anticipated 2020 season cut dramatically short, the Arkansas Razorbacks baseball team is ready and so is B-Unlimited.
  • On Monday, the popular NWA-based apparel company, B-Unlimited launched their Rooting For The Home Team Arkansas Baseball apparel line. Whether you're cheering from home or from a seat at Baum Stadium this season, B-Unlimited will have you game day ready.
  • Subscriber Special: Use the code daily10 for 10% off your purchase.

posts.title: Key Points: Washington Co. State-of-the-County Address
posts.content:
Washington County's State-of-the-County address went live virtually on Monday - if you missed it, we've got you covered. Here are a few key takeaways from the event:

  1. The county judge’s budget was reduced by 1% from 2019.
  2. Washington County saw a 24% increase in new construction from 2019.
  3. The Emergency Management department coordinated the disbursement of over 100,000 units of PPE in response to COVID-19.
  4. The grants department received more than $10 million in grants

County Judge Joseph Wood mentioned that the county would prioritize improving leadership in services by focusing on infrastructure, public safety, and employee training in 2021. “We’re one of the fastest-growing regions in the United States. My vision for Washington County is to lead Arkansas by having exemplary leaders making good decisions for better services in Washington County," Wood said. -KNWA/Fox24

posts.title: Did Someone Say... Concert Series... in 2021?
posts.content:
You heard right. If you're someone who has a concert-sized hole in your heart after a year of quarantine, you're not alone. The City of Rogers has recently announced that the under-construction Butterfield Stage at Railyard Park is gearing up for the 2021 Concert Series.

  • If you're looking to put in your two cents about who you want to see perform at the stage, fill out this form.
  • Anna Watson, the city's arts and culture coordinator, said the tentative plan for Butterfield Stage at Railyard Park is to have several concerts from late April through October. Some will be free while some will require paid tickets, she said. - NWA Democrat-Gazette
  • The City of Rogers entered a one-year, $150,000 contract with Crowne Group in Fayetteville for event marketing and programming for the new stage. Brian Crowne of Crowne Group also owns George's Majestic Lounge in Fayetteville and is the VP of Walmart Arkansas Music Pavilion in Rogers.
  • "This would be a turn-key style contract. We feel very confident in Brian's unique ability to build a great music experience from top to bottom," Watson said. - NWA Democrat Gazette

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Hybrid grapes: Yep, the Arkansas wine industry has two new wine grape varieties, created by the late James N. Moore, who founded the Arkansas fruit breeding program in 1964.
  • Verified Hog: Arkansas Razorback Jalen Catalon earned the highest number of Instagram followers in ALL of college football. Quite a feat.
  • Heart Warmer: Salvation Army locations in Bentonville and Fayetteville will open their doors to provide a warm space for those in need anytime the wind-chill is 34 degrees or below. 5 News
  • Work with us: NWA Daily wants to feature your business! Check out the advertising options on our website.
